page.title: 10Alveston School Memories.
page.content: Some children from St. Helens School talked to Mrs. Summers who was a pupil at the old St. Helens School. She was also a pupil teacher, a teacher and a deputy head. "I remember how we always sat in long rows throughout the day and always in our own places, never getting up. Children today have so much freedom in and out of the classroom, they don't know how to sit still. I remember the headmaster stood in front of the coal fire with his hands always behind his back." "We always went to Sunday School. We wore our best clothes which we were only allowed to wear on a Sunday." "After school we had another pinefore on. I enjoyed sewing. The candles and oil lights brought the darkness early." " I think I would prefer 1985!"
